N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2186.9 - Reporting requirements

State Regulations
(a) General. Grantees will submit such reports related to the program as the agency
may reasonably require. (b) Progress
reports. Commencing from the date of execution of the grant agreement up to and
including the date of project close-out, the grantee must submit progress
reports in such form as the agency may require which shall be quarterly or on
an alternative schedule if the agency agrees to accept reports submitted in
connection with another program providing funds for the same project funded by
the IDDP. Reports shall include, but shall not be limited to, information
concerning each project's construction schedule, construction costs, status of
the housing project(s) and problems, if any, encountered in carrying out the
project(s) or program. (c) Annual
report. The grantee shall submit a report to the agency on or before December
1st of each year or on an alternative schedule if the agency agrees to accept
reports submitted in connection with another program providing funds for the
same project funded by the IDDP. Such report shall include, but not be limited
to: (1)
the name of the grantee and the
amount of the grant; (2)
a
narrative description of the specified infrastructure improvement activities
performed by such eligible applicant; (3)
a narrative description of each
affordable housing project, including location, undertaken in conjunction with
such infrastructure improvements which shall include, but not be limited to the
total number of units in each project; and
(4)
any funding sources leveraged for such
affordable housing project. (d) Litigation. The grantee will promptly
notify the agency as to the existence of any litigation which may affect the
project(s) or program. Notes
